intro: Miconia oligotricha, commonly known as the hairy miconia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom during the wet season. Miconia oligotricha is typically found in humid, lowland forests and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it has been introduced to other tropical regions, though it can become invasive in some areas.
